replies.body: Let me guess, puny ADC's are way too squishy.

Unless I'm Mordekaiser bot. 

I also have a hard time with assassins. My usual playstyle in games is to be as durable as possible so I can go in, realize I fucked up royal, and hopefully live long enough to escape or solve the problem.

dude i like that play style, i hate being squishy AF and having to depend on team mates to peel for me... sometimes i get these items as adc{{item:3053}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3512}}, i'm not a fan of {{item:3026}}

It's the one I've just grown to love.  It started with playing a tank in wow PuGs and then I kinda just grew addicted.  I used to hate tanking because I never felt like I could really hurt anyone without back up.  Now?  I fucking love being a tank.

Everyone else can try and satisfy their bloodlust, I'll just keep their targets steady.  God, if people didn't look at me funny for {{champion:14}} support then I would be a support main.
ikr sion supp is good, there are some hard matches where alistar,braum or leona would fit better but it still good, he can peel really great and when the jungler ganks after he's 6 its a kill secured

The looks they give you after the game (awe from your team and hate from the enemy) are well worth any weird looks before the game. Trust me, I main support Sion. 

Also, I love just walking my 100 health adc back to the tower while tanking an entire Lucian ult - it leaves a pleasant, tickling feeling.
I love tanking Jhin's ult.
Just sit there and laugh. If I'm feeling a little mean I'll /all "that tickles :)"
I've literally had teammates call me a bodyguard in all chat.
{{item:3026}} is only for players that plan on dying >;)

i dont like it because as adc is hard to find team mates that peel for you, blablablah i know about positioning and i always try to play safer and hit the first one that gets in my range, but when an enemy just walk right through my whole team and one shots me, while my team is aiming to get the enemy carries without even realizing that i died... i rather not have GA, have some of the other defensive stats to survive burst and only trust myself
Galio all day.
Galio ADC?
I was talking about the go in and fuck up thing. But if you're really feeling Galio adc... be my guest.

Lol nope. I tried bill l, but that was taken. Billx was also taken. So billxx. I use it for most everything

The only adc i play.

I know he's the metal man, but even I find it **iron**ic that he's called an ADC... but everyone builds AP on him.

WHY IS ADC SYNONYMOUS WITH BOT EVEN IF YOU DON'T BUILD AD 

D:
hes more of an adc supplement.
Isn't that usually called a "support?"
My friend, that was a joke on the definition of supplement. A supplement means to add to something, and supports tend to be a more literal "ADC supplement."
-Waits for MM to come in- http://i.imgur.com/b2qtPpO.png

ADC stands for attack damage carry , right ?
Just swich the d with a p ( no pun intended ).
There , all done ðŸ˜Š, have fun .

APC is already a thing.

I'm just poking at fun that people find one role synonymous with a lane that they will call anyone bot an ADC, even if its a melee AP juggernaut.

:P
I have to wonder how ADC's manage to keep their CS so high after lane phase. I can never farm properly once mid-game reaches because either team needs me or it's too dangerous to go out and farm.

Trick is to wander off to an open lane any time your team backs off.  Clear it completely, then go back to what you were doing before.  Keeps the lane pushed and stops side lane farm from being wasted.

> [{quoted}](name=Catastrop,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=dZq1hp2a,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-03-31T18:44:36.663+0000)
>
> I have to wonder how ADC's manage to keep their CS so high after lane phase. I can never farm properly once mid-game reaches because either team needs me or it's too dangerous to go out and farm.

Farm jungle camps and manage multiple waves at once. Depending on what elo you're in people might not manage waves and just open themselves up to map pressure by sitting mid for no reason.

Just go to side waves whenever there's a wave built up, clear it and move on to the next jungle camps/lane. When you sit in that lane with no purpose other than more farm is when it becomes a problem, this opens your team up to extended times of pressure and could also lead to you getting ganked if you go too far up without reasonable vision on the enemy team.

If you're managing waves to keep map pressure in your favor and then your team jumps in 4v5 then blames you for not being there, they're idiots and you should just ignore them.

Never try to keep bot lane in check if baron could be on the table for the enemy team while you're gone, there are strict times that you have to identify when it is ok to be in a side lane and for how long you can be in that side lane. 

Once you learn how to properly rotate between lanes and also clear jungle camps effectively, you will see your farm numbers and general gold income skyrocket. You may also find yourself dying less because you won't be sitting somewhere like mid trying to siege against high waveclear while they flank you, or anything else that's pointless.

play lucian or ezreal.  they have a more fun and easy to understand caster style and have mobility to correct positioning mistakes.  those are my two main adcs and i usually do ok, even though i'm a top lane main.  the thing with blue ezreal tho is that you have to play lane pretty passive because you build mana and not damage early, and you can't really push out that well.  lucian is a lot better for lane, and is incredibly fun to play
I love playing {{champion:236}} when he is free (which he is this week, so fun!) and it really does fit my preference of casters.  But I'm still better at tanking then positioning.
Try Graves. He's got a tank-like position style.
I do like graves. But I don't play ADC enough to remember I have him.
